comment: When I got to class one day, I saw no one was there. Found out she canceled class without sending any email. Was a post about it on her D2L announcements, but never received an email. She has done this once before. I missed one class before (I emailed with no response) came to 2 classes later to see the door locked. I wasted 12 dollars on parking.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Not an easy intro-level course. Test are confusing, I failed each one. Did not respond to any of the eight emails I sent her. If you are interested in art history and would like a challenging course with lots of material this may be for you. If you simply need an easy fine art for your major I would not suggest this professor.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: I've had her for two classes now and she's very nice and knowledgeable, very easy to reach outside of class. She does tend to come late to lectures, though. Lenient grader and goes out of her way to help, would love to have her again!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Lecture heavy

comment: She cancelled half our classes. A couple times, she cancelled 20-40 minutes ALREADY into our class time while we all sat there waiting on her. For the classes she did make, she would be 15-20 minutes late on average. Attendance is mandatory or else your grade is dropped. She deleted proof of her constant cancelling so we couldn't report her.

I was wary of taking Professor Wingfield's ARH2850 Ren-Mod Art history course but honestly, I did not have any issues with her. I found her lectures well versed and easy to participate. Please be aware that she does tend to update her syllabus so you will need to check on that and there are some discussions she won't always remind you of.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Constantly goes off topic during presentations and lectures. Sets the due date of assignments to 6:00pm so if you have any afternoon classes that day you just can't do the assignment unless you had the foresight to do it a day early. Exams have absurd questions like matching artworks together and expects you to read her mind to answer correctly.

I have taken professor Wingfield twice. For Native Art and the capstone thesis class. In her first class, she had a family death, and was very hard to contact. Understandable. Otherwise the class was fine. In the capstone class, she was horrible with feedback and never responded to emails. This was awful because it is our GRAD THESIS.
rating_tags: Caring

comment: No consideration for the student's time as assignments/syllabus are always changed last minute with added requirements. Presentations are all over the place and she constantly gets off topic. The expectations for this class are ridiculous especially for an intro elective class it's almost unrealistic. Overall, very disorganized and stressful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: If you're looking for an easy elective class with little work, find someone else. She will have you making at least 30 flashcards over art pieces, she is always pushing assignments back and changing the rubric/schedule around, in class lectures and powerpoints are so bad and disorganized.
Very hard class for International student, lot of hard vocabulary and you have to take note for what she said!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: She is the worst professor I've ever had. She's unorganized and inconsistent, her "flashcard" homework is completely unnecessary, all of her tests are short answer and take at least a week to complete, every weekly module has 3-4 lecture videos that are each 1 hour long, she takes forever to grade, and never responds to emails. DO NOT take her!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: She gave 8hrs work of practices for one week of class. Her lecture requirements are just unacceptable for students with 4 other classes. The amount of flash cards for a single week are way to heavy to handle.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Wingfield is a very sweet and caring professor. You can tell she is very passionate and knows her subjects. Her lectures are heavily focused on her talking rather than info on screen. Be prepared to take good notes. Tests were standard difficulty. Did not enjoy the papers though. Overall happy with her class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: I think reviews are being a little hard on her here! She did take forever to grade, but the class was relatively easy compared to other art history teachers at ksu, and she's so nice and understanding. Just show up as much as you can, take good notes and pay attention to what she says matters (she's makes it very obvious) and it's a pretty easy A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Has some time-management problems (tries to fit too many topics into class period and ends up rushing; not enough time to complete exams; takes FOREVER to grade), but is a great teacher who really cares about her subject and students. Lots of extra credit, & very lenient grading. Make sure you take GOOD notes during lectures, and don't miss any!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: She was gone for an entire month (September), and she didnt grade anything until the end of the semester. The hw assignments had almost nothing to do with the material we learned. The only upside to this corse was that she was a kind person.
rating_tags: So many papers--Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: She is so disorganized that she stresses me out and I am the student! You get a lot of busy work but she is an easy grader. I would say take her as a last option. She is also horrible at communication but she will recognize you for good work.

This is one of the worst professors I have ever had. You will not know your grade until the end of the semester. You also have an assignment or more due before every class. She also cancelled class for entire month and expected this class to be the only class that you cared about. She also went off on us in class because "no one was caring enough"
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Took Wingfield for Art 1107 expecting an easy A. This was my hardest class. Attendance is mandatory. She did not post grades the entire semester, and every student did not know how they were performing. EXPECT to visit different art museums at least 5x. She canceled class for almost a month. She had "online class" days with 2-4 hours worth of work.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: She canceled class for the entire month of september and we ended up having one class back and then a midterm. and she gives very tedious and excessively long online class when she cancels. hasnt posted any grades and its november. cancels class less than an hour before class starts. attendance is mandatory but nothing in lecture helps for exams.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Every lecture has a powerpoint that can be more than 100 slides long, and about 5% of that information will be helpful for exams. Made worse is the fact that she goes way too fast to write down anything of substance before going to the next slide. It's not difficult or challenging, just tedious and irritating.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: She is all over the place in her lectures. Theres an assignment due everyday after class, yet she hasnt put any grades in other than the first exam and its November. Shes also cancelled class at least 4 times and assigns ridiculously long online busy work. This class is way too in-depth for an intro class and Id recommend you take someone else.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Lots of homework

comment: Most stressful class I have had. I am actually very interested in art & was excited to learn but the way this course is taught ruined it for me. She canceled almost every class until our midterm & hasn't changed anything about our assignments. Wasn't an online class. You will be required to learn ridiculous details over 35+ artworks. Save yourself.

She doesn't really teach so much as throw facts at you. I consider myself someone who can pick up on subjects rather easily, and even I found myself struggling trying to figure out what to take notes on. She jumps all over the place, and her lectures are just explaining art pieces instead of talking about the specific cultures they pertain to.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Would not recommend. Presents info instead of teaching students to retain it. Monotone. Canceled class three times in a row. Springs assignments last minute. No consideration for students' time. Easy grader but attendance is mandatory and you must participate to pass. Does NOT effectively teach the subject. Does not grade in a timely manner.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: The course is very intensive but Laura Wingfield makes it extremely interesting. There are two papers, one Museum visit with a small research, two take-home exams, and one class presentation. She helps a lot and you are pretty free on the choice of your subjects. She is an easy grader as well. Take it and youll know some good stuff.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Inspirational
